title: Maus0728
author: Maus0728
content: Well, I know this isn't a concern but I was curious to know how the hell this Newbie account's post does not reflect in the "Show the last posts of this person" The post count says he had 6 previous post which is true[1], but it isn't reflected in the history. Plus, there are lots of them.I am suspecting that posts in ANN(Altcoins) is counted but does not reflect in the history? I may have missed this.[1] https://ninjastic.space/search?author=kurry&board=159

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: There's no problem at all to my side, seems like you have ignored the board for altcoins or related boards which is the reasons why it doesnt show to you.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: I also have no issue accessing the user's post history, so it's most likely only from your end.Majority of the users posts are in the Altcoin Announcement section and also in the economics board; do you by any chance have both of them on ignore?

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on July 01, 2022, 08:48:36 AMThere's no problem at all to my side, seems like you have ignored the board for altcoins or related boards which is the reasons why it doesnt show to you.Yes, that's what happens. We have had several threads of this style in Meta. One of them was opened by myself. When things like the OP's happen to us we are clueless and it doesn't occur to us to think that it is because we have ignored boards.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: I saw all the six posts the user posted, no issue at all. Just click on your profile -> lgnore Boards Preferences. You will be able to see the boards you ignored. If you did not ignor the boards, you should be able to see the posts, so you can temporary uncheck the boards to see and read the posts contents.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on July 01, 2022, 08:48:36 AMThere's no problem at all to my side, seems like you have ignored the board for altcoins or related boards which is the reasons why it doesnt show to you.yep, looks like this is what happened.Â  I tried to put meta on ignore and check Maus0728 post history and couldn't find this thread on his post history. also, this is news to me, I thought when putting a board on ignore you'd still be able to see on their post history that they have posted on the ignored board but would not be able to see the content of the post.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Ohh okay! Thanks for all the response!I have ignored these boards a long time ago due to convoluted thread that are of zero value, I just didn't realize it was the cause. And yeah, locking the thread.
